result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 4-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

The first 20 days to be served straight time. The balance can be with Huber for the Day Reporting Program. No objection to electronic monitoring while in the program.  Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.  Credit for 4 days time served.........****June 24,2014/ Defendant failed to comply with rules of Electronic Monitoring/In-house programs.  Court ordered a commitment out for service.  Court orders the defendant to serve the balance of the sentence without any release privileges.***
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Tyrone Moton

records.descr: Request to correct error in court records
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant failed to appear at the House of Correction.  Court ordered a commitment out for service.  Court orders the defendant to serve the balance of the sentence without any release privileges.  Original commitment received and filed.

FAILURE TO REPORT COMMITMENT REFERRAL:
.
Failure to Report Commitment Referral received from the HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Konkol, Br 44, for review. TK

Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 20 days to be served straight time - the balance can be with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program and 4 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 4-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in court.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case called at 9:47 a.m.  Attorney Dluzak does not appear.  Court is starting a jury trial and adjourns case.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  William Levins for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/27/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in court with attorney Mark A Dluzak.  Defendant Anthony Tyrone Moton in custody.   Student Intern Katie Shaw under the supervision of Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
